afficio: <entryFree id="n1461" type="main" key="affi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-fĭcĭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>affēci</itype> (adf-), affectum (adf-), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n1461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do something</hi> to one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to exert an influence on body</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that it is brought into such or such a state</hi> (used by the poets rarely, by Hor. never). </sense><sense id="n1461.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1461.2" n="A" level="2"> Of the body rarely, and then commonly in a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aestus, labor, fames, sitisque corpora adficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliis adficere corpora sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non simplex Damasichthona vulnus Adficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aconitum cor adficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 188" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus adficere M. Antonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo totus adficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">abl. of spec.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomacho et vesicā adfici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 186" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 186</bibl></cit>. —In bon. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ita adficiendum est, ut oboedire rationi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1461.3" n="B" level="2"> More freq. of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae sic me adfecerunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is terror milites hostesque in diversum adfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varie sum adfectus tuis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules oportere sic adfici, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:90" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfici a Gratiā aut a Voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 29, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudo de te duplex nos adficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti ei qui audirent, sic adficerentur animis, ut eos adfici vellet orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">adfici animos in diversum habitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.4" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to affect a person</hi> or (rarely) <hi rend="ital">thing with something;</hi> in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to bestow upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace with;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to visit with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict upon;</hi> or the ablative and verb may be rendered by the verb corresponding to the ablative, and if an adjective accompany the ablative, this adjective becomes an adverb.—Of inanimate things (rare): luce locum adficiens, <hi rend="ital">lighting up the place</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 250, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adficere medicamine vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum non eo nomine adficiendum,</quote> <trans><tr>designated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:24:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 24, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res honore adficere,</quote> <trans><tr>to honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non postulo, ut dolorem eisdem verbis adficias, quibus Epicurus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.5" n="3" level="3"> Very freq. of persons. </sense><sense id="n1461.6" n="(a)" level="5"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui praedā atque agro adoreāque adfecit populares suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem sepulturā adficit,</quote> <trans><tr>buries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres adfecerat gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine regis,</quote> <trans><tr>to style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis nuntiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 30, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 27, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.7" n="(b)" level="5"> In a bad sense: injuriā abs te adficior indignā, pater, <hi rend="ital">am wronged unjustly</hi>, Enn. ap. Auct. ad Heren. 2, 24, 38; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quantā me curā et sollicitudine adficit Gnatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore,</quote> <trans><tr>to terrify</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultate,</quote> <trans><tr>to embarrass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 22, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 20, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum et verborum acerbitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilio,</quote> <trans><tr>to banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Thras. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte, cruciatu, cruce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimis cruciatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Regg. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Regg. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—And often in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudine et inopiā consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfici aegritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloribus pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiā rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitate et injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā poenā, Auct. B. G. 8, 39: vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> R. R. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torminibus et inflationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 33, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">affectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n1461.8" n="I" level="1"> In a peculiar sense, <hi rend="ital">that on which we have bestowed labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which we are now doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that it is nearly at an end;</hi> cf.: Adfecta, sicut M. Cicero et <pb n="67" /> <cb n="AFFI" /> veterum elegantissime locuti sunt, ea proprie dicebantur, quae non ad finem ipsum, sed proxime finem progressa deductave erant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum adfectum videmus et paene confectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciā (Caesar) commoratur, ut ea. quae per eum adfecta sunt, perfecta rei publicae tradat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: cum adfectā prope aestate uvas a sole mitescere tempus, etc., <hi rend="ital">near the end of summer</hi>, id. ap. Gell. l. c.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jamque hieme adfectā mitescere coeperat annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:502" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Q. Mucii infirmissimā valetudine adfectāque jam aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1,45,200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2,4,43, § 95</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n1461.9" n="II" level="1"> In nearly the same sense as the verb, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> and with <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n1461.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n1461.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Of persons laboring under disease, or not yet quite recovered: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui cum ita adfectus esset, ut sibi ipse diffideret,</quote> <trans><tr>was in such a state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem Neapoli adfectum graviter videam,</quote> <trans><tr>very ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem adfectum visuros crediderant,</quote> <trans><tr>ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus adfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectae vires corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>reduced strength</tr>, <tr>weakness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:24:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegra et adfecta mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam quidem adfectum, sed tamen spirantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.12" n="(b)" level="5"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem istam rei publicae male adfectam tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfecta res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid est enim non ita adfectum, ut non deletum exstinctumque esse fateare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mihi (Sicilia) adfecta visa est, ut hae terrae solent, in quibus bellum versatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfecta res familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem rebus adfectis orare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:60" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.13" n="(g)" level="5"> Of persons, in gen. sense, <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quonam modo, Philumena mea, nunc te offendam adfectam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo sim adfectus, e Leptā poteris cognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eodem modo erga amicum adfecti simus, quo erga nosmetipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ita simus adfecti, ut non possimus plane simul vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculus conturbatus non est probe adfectus ad suum munus fungendum,</quote> <trans><tr>in proper state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi nimis arguti, quem ad modum animo adfecti simus, loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 41, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.14" n="(d)" level="5"> As rhet. t. t.: affectus ad, <hi rend="ital">related to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tum ex eis rebus, quae quodam modo affectae sunt ad id, de quo quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 8</bibl></cit> Forcellini.—</sense><sense id="n1461.15" n="B" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case> chiefly of persons, in indifferent sense, in good or bad sense (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Animi quem ad modum adfecti sint, virtutibus, vitiis, artibus, inertiis, aut quem ad modum commoti, cupiditate, metu, voluptate, molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 10, 35</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n1461.16" n="(a)" level="5"> In indifferent sense, <hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">validos lictores ulmeis affectos lentis virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari filo similique (corpora) adfecta figurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantāne adfectum quemquam esse hominem audaciā!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1461.17" n="(b)" level="5"> In bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudine, morbo adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 7:5:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> R. R. 7, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore et penuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfecta sterilitate terra, Col. R. R. praef. 1, 2: vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnere corpus adfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Cic. Fam. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remiges inopiā adfectissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:84" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1461.18" n="(g)" level="5"> In good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficio adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo honore aut imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudine optimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>, and ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munere deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 90</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">affectē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">with</hi> (a strong) <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblectamur et contristamur et conterremur in somniis quam adfecte et anxie et passibiliter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
afficticius: <entryFree id="n1462" type="hapax" key="afficti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affictĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>affingo</etym>, <sense id="n1462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">added to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annexed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affictus: <entryFree id="n1463" type="main" key="affictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affictus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. affingo. <cb n="AFFI" /></entryFree>
affigo: <entryFree id="n1464" type="main" key="affi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-fīgo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ixi, ixum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (affixet for affixisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:536" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 536</bibl>), <sense id="n1464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach to;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n1464.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera aetherieis adfixa caverneis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1238" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1238</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteram ad caput,</quote> <trans><tr>to affix as a brand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva, cui pinnarum talaria adfigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prometheus adfixus Caucaso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: aliquem patibulo, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 355</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cuspide ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cruci adfigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa Punicis Adfixa delubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto te adfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus me lectulo adfixit): radicem terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam lateri (turris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:536 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 536 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n1464.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fix on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impress on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid animo,</quote> <trans><tr>to impress upon the mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras pueris,</quote> <trans><tr>to imprint on their memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n1464.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fastened to a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joined to;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad rem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubes eum mihi esse adfixum tamquam magistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me sibi ille adfixum habebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in exiguā parte terrae adfixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus adfixa foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarraconensis adfixa Pyrenaeo,</quote> <trans><tr>situated close to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">impressed on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa in animo sensuque meo penitus adfixa atque insita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae semper adfixa esse videntur ad rem neque ab eā possunt separari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 26 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1464.4" n="B" level="2"> In the Latin of the Pandects: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adfixa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the appendages</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appurtenances belonging to a possession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum instructam legavit cum omnibus adfixis,</quote> <trans><tr>with all pertaining thereto</tr>, <tr>all the fixtures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
affiguro: <entryFree id="n1465" type="hapax" key="affi^gu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-fĭgūro</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n1465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashion after</hi> the analogy of something else: <hi rend="ital">disciplinosus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consiliosus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victoriosus</hi>, quae M. Cato ita (i.e. like <hi rend="ital">vinosus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formosus</hi>, etc.) adfiguravit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affingo: <entryFree id="n1466" type="main" key="affingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-fingo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n1466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">invent</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">as an addition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appendage</hi> to another. </sense><sense id="n1466.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (esp. of artists). </sense><sense id="n1466.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ei manus adfinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepta, adficta villae quae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1466.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nullam partem corporis sine aliquā necessitate adfictam reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:45:179" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 45, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1466.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add falsely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">without grounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam ut intellegatis, quid error adfinxerit, quid invidia conflārit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium hoc oculis adfingere noli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vera laus ei detracta oratione nostrā, neque falsa adficta esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">addunt ipsi et adfingunt rumoribus Galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui crimen adfingeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>might be falsely imputed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 62</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1466.5" n="III" level="1"> In a general signif. </sense><sense id="n1466.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to annex</hi> (always with the accessory idea of <hi rend="ital">forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devising</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sint cubilia gallinarum aut exsculpta aut adficta firmiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: multa natura aut adfingit (<hi rend="ital">creating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she adds</hi> thereto) aut mutat aut detrahit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:62:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 62, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum alteri adfinxit, de altero limavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1466.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 139, 34</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
affinis: <entryFree id="n1467" type="main" key="affi_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-fīnis</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>abl.</case> adfini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 66</bibl>; <sense id="n1467.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">once adfine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. II. 222</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n1467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that is neighboring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a neighbor to one</hi> (ADFINES: in agris vicini, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 11</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">bordering on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjacent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contiguous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens adfinis Mauris, = confinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevisque adfinis Sarmata Moschis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 430</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">near by family relationship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">related to by marriage</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">khdestei=s</foreign>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a relation by marriage</hi> (opp. consanguinei, <foreign lang="greek">suggenei=s</foreign>), as explained by Modestin. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfines dicuntur viri et uxoris cognati. Adfinium autem nomina sunt socer, socrus, gener, nurus, noverca, vitricus, privignus, privigna, glos, levir, etc.: ego ut essem adfinis tibi, tuam petii gnatam, Att. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. numero, p. 170 Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 201 Rib.): Megadorus meus adfinis,</quote> <trans><tr>my son-in-law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu me, adfinem tuum, repulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 7</bibl></cit>: ex tam multis cognatis et adfinibus,<cb n="AFFL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Quir. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem ejus adfinem esse audiebant, Auct. B. Afr. 32: quanto plus propinquorum, quo major adfinium numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per propinquos et adfines suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfinia vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1467.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taking part in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privy to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associated with;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen.;</hi> in Pac. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: qui sese adfines esse ad causandum volunt, Pac.ap.<bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 89, 11</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 80 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">publicis negotiis adfinis, i. e. implicitus, particeps,</quote> <trans><tr>taking part in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos solos video adfines et turpitudini judicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic facinori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:44:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 44, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affinitas: <entryFree id="n1468" type="main" key="affi_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affīnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>affinis</etym> (<sense id="n1468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> adfinitatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">the state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of</hi> adfinis. </sense><sense id="n1468.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Relationship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alliance by marriage</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">between a father and son-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 12</bibl> Ruhnk. (cf. affinis): <cit><quote lang="la">adstringere inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas generis humani serpit sensim foras, cognationibus primum, tum adfinitatibus, deinde amicitiis, post vicinitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfinitate se devincire cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo adfinitate conjungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adfinitatem alicujus pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfinitate conjunctus,</quote> <trans><tr>allied by marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adfinitatis jura succedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the persons so related</hi>, like <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi> in Engl.: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam deseras, cognatos, adfinitatem, amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1468.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">relationship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: per adfinitatem litterarum, qui <foreign lang="greek">fw/r</foreign> Graece, Latine fur est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta est adfinitas corporibus hominum mentibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affirmanter: <entryFree id="n1469" type="main" key="affirmanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affirmanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">affirmātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <sense id="n1469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. affirmo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
affirmatio: <entryFree id="n1470" type="main" key="affirma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affirmātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>affirmo</etym>, <sense id="n1470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an affirmation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirmation</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">averment of a fact</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assertion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim jus jurandum adfirmatio religiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29</bibl></cit>; so Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem venire alicujus adfirmatione de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantissima annalium adfirmatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">multā abfirmatione abnuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affirmativus: <entryFree id="n1471" type="hapax" key="affirma_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affirmātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n1471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">affirming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirmative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 390</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
affirmator: <entryFree id="n1472" type="main" key="affirma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affirmātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who asserts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affirms a thing</hi> (only in late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:7:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
affirmo: <entryFree id="n1473" type="main" key="affirmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-firmo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n1473.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To present</hi> a thing in words, <hi rend="ital">as fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true; to assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asseverate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendum est mihi, sed ita, nihil ut adfirmem, quaeram omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure jurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam plures Deo ortos adfirmant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfirmavit non daturum se,</quote> <trans><tr>he protested that he would give nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque affirmatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1473.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give confirmation</hi> of the truth of a thing, <hi rend="ital">to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corroborate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfirmare spem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid auctoritate sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani virtutem armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secuta anceps valetudo iram Deūm adfirmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">affirmanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> (of the <hi rend="ital">absol. P. a.</hi> affirmans), <hi rend="ital">with assurance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; and: <orth extent="full" lang="la">af-firmātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> (of the <hi rend="ital">absol. P. a.</hi> affirmatus), <hi rend="ital">with asseveration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with assurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">positively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adfirmate, quasi Deo teste promiserit, id tenendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfirmatissime scribere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affixio: <entryFree id="n1474" type="main" key="affixi^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affixĭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>affigo</etym>, <sense id="n1474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fastening to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an addition</hi> (only in late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">continua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1, 327</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">a zealous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent attachment to a thing</hi>: philologiae, Capell. 1, p. 14.</sense></entryFree>
affixus: <entryFree id="n1475" type="main" key="affixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">affixus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from affigo.</entryFree>
afflagrans: <entryFree id="n1476" type="hapax" key="affla_grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflāgrans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>afflagro</etym>, <sense id="n1476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blazing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flaming up;</hi> fig.: in tempore<pb n="68" /> <cb n="AFFL" />  adflagranti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in an unquiet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turbulent time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
afflator: <entryFree id="n1477" type="main" key="affla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>afflo</etym>, <sense id="n1477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who blows on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathes into</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
afflatus: <entryFree id="n1478" type="main" key="affla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, of afflo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1479" type="main" key="affla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>afflo</etym>. <sense id="n1479.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A blowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathing on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">as of the wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">men</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflatusex terrā mentem ita movens ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflatu nocent,</quote> <trans><tr>by the effluvia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambusti adflatu vaporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes caelestes adussisse levi adflatu vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 26 al.</bibl></cit> —Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes adflatibus (apri) ardent,</quote> <trans><tr>by his breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:527" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polypus adflatu terribili canes agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 92</bibl></cit>.—And of the <hi rend="ital">aspiration</hi> in speech: Boeotii sine adflatu vocant collīs Tebas, i. e. without the <hi rend="ital">h</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1479.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a flash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glow of light</hi> (cf. afflo, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">juncturae leni adflatu simulacra refovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 22, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1479.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">afflation of the divine spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo vir magnus sine aliquo adflatu divino umquam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine inflammatione animorum et sine quodam adflatu quasi furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
afflecto: <entryFree id="n1480" type="hapax" key="afflecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-flecto</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>exi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n1480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">direct to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic si sol adflexerit axes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 734</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
affleo: <entryFree id="n1481" type="main" key="affle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-flĕo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n1481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weep at</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adfleat, quom ea memoret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adflet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flentibus adflat Humani voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 101</bibl></cit>, where Keller reads <hi rend="ital">adsunt.</hi></sense></entryFree>
afflictatio: <entryFree id="n1482" type="main" key="afflicta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>afflicto</etym>, <sense id="n1482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment of body</hi>, acc. to Cicero's explanation: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictatio (est) aegritudo cum vexatione corporis, Tusc. 4, 8, 18: sollicitudo, molestia, adflictatio, desperatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
afflictator: <entryFree id="n1483" type="main" key="afflicta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who causes pain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tormentor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
afflictio: <entryFree id="n1484" type="hapax" key="afflicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>affligo</etym>, <sense id="n1484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
afflicto: <entryFree id="n1485" type="main" key="afflicto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflicto</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ad, intensive</etym>, <sense id="n1485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disquiet greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toss; to shatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, lit. and trop. </sense><sense id="n1485.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">naves tempestas adflictabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod minuente aestu (naves) in vadis adflictarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>were stranded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Batavos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—Far oftener, </sense><sense id="n1485.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>: adflictari amore, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines aegri febri jactantur ... deinde multo gravius adflictantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictatur res publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites equosque adflictare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictare ltaliam luxuriā saevitiāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence, adflictare se or adflictari aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to grieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be greatly troubled in mind about a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very anxious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uneasy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to afflict one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te adflictes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se Alcibiades adflictaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de domesticis rebus acerbissime adflictor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres adflictare sese, manus supplices ad caelum tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
afflictor: <entryFree id="n1486" type="hapax" key="afflictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>affligo</etym>, <sense id="n1486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who strikes a thing to</hi> the ground, and trop., <hi rend="ital">one who destroys</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overthrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a subverter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictor et perditor dignitatis et auctoritatis (senatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
afflictus: <entryFree id="n1487" type="main" key="afflictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from affligo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1488" type="hapax" key="afflictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes adflictu ignem dant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 63, 36</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
affligo: <entryFree id="n1489" type="main" key="affli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-flīgo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>ixi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (afflixint = afflixerint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 3, 3</bibl>). <sense id="n1489.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat a thing to</hi> some point, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throw down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dash</hi>, somewhere <hi rend="ital">by striking;</hi> esp. of ships which are driven or cast away by the wind. —Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ad terram, scelus, adfligam,</quote> <trans><tr>I will dash thee to the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo equidem te adfligi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw down</tr>, <tr>overthrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32</bibl></cit>: domum, id. pro Dom. 40: (alces) si quo adflictae casu conciderint, Caes. B. G. <cb n="AFFL" /> 6, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmas arbores pondere adfligunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas naves Rhodias adflixit, ita ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>dashed them about</tr>, <tr>shattered them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—So in descriptions of a battle: <cit><quote lang="la">equi atque viri adflicti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J.101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J.101,11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi scalae comminutae, qui supersteterant, adflicti sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>were thrown down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Mars communis et victum saepe erigeret et adfligeret victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput saxo,</quote> <trans><tr>to dash against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila duos corvos adflixit et ad terram dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:631" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 631</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n1489.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n1489.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi>: cum prospero flatu ejus (fortunae) utimur, ad exitus pervehimur optatos; <cit><quote lang="la">et cum reflavit, adfligimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus nostra nos adflixit,</quote> <trans><tr>has ruined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius ipse se adflixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus enervat et adfligit homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonianas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 66</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n1489.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lessen in value</hi> (syn. minuo): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc oratoris esse maxime proprium, rem augere posse laudando, vituperandoque rursus adfligere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of courage, <hi rend="ital">to cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishearten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos adfligere et debilitare metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1489.4" n="C" level="2"> Adfligere causam susceptam, <hi rend="ital">to let a lawsuit which has been undertaken fall through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 41, 89</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">afflictus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n1489.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miserable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distressed;</hi> lit. and trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>damaged</tr>, <tr>shattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia perculsa et adflicta et perdita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab adflictā amicitiā transfugere et ad florentem aliam devolare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non integra fortuna, at adflicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictum erigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictiore condicione esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6,1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: res adflictae (like accisae and adfectae),</quote> <trans><tr>disordered</tr>, <tr>embarrassed</tr>, <tr>ruined circumstances</tr>, <tr>affairs in a bad state</tr>, <tr>ill condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 496</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1489.6" n="B" level="2"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n1489.7" n="1" level="3"> Of the mind: <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dejected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discouraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desponding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudine adflictus, debilitatus, jacens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictus vitam in tenebris luctuque trahebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1489.8" n="2" level="3"> Of character, like abjectus, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outcast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depraved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo adflictus et perditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo tam adflictis est moribus, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not used.</sense></entryFree>
afflo: <entryFree id="n1490" type="main" key="afflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">af-flo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n1490.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe on;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case> or <case>dat.</case>—Of the air: <cit><quote lang="la">udam (fabam) ventus adflavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflantur vineta noto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:146" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem sparsum cervicibus adflare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflatus aurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>. —Also of other things which exert an influence upon bodies, like a current of air; e. g. fire, light, vapor, etc.: et calidum membris adflare vaporem, <hi rend="ital">and breathe a glow</hi> (lit. <hi rend="ital">a warm vapor</hi>) <hi rend="ital">upon our limbs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 508</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veiut illis Canidia adflāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ubi primus equis oriens adflavit anhelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 250</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 739</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus (fulminum) adflari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflati incendio,</quote> <trans><tr>touched</tr>, <tr>scorched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammā ex Aetnā monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Fragm. Serv. ad Verg. G. 1:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fragm. Serv. ad Verg.
