<bibl default="NO">1, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1545.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1545.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To heap up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to augment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incenditque animum dictis atque aggerat iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 197</bibl></cit>, and 11, 342: <cit><quote lang="la">omne promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:198" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1545.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1545.4" n="C" level="2"> Aggerare arborem, in gardening, <hi rend="ital">to heap up</hi> earth <hi rend="ital">around a tree</hi> in order to protect the roots, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1546" type="main" key="agge^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-gĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n1546.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi> a place; with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <case>dat.</case> (in Plaut. freq.; in the class. per. rare; in Cic. perh. only once; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq. in Tac.): quom eorum aggerimus bona, quin etiam ultro ipsi aggerunt ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi his aggerunda etiam est aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 6</bibl>: luta et limum aggerebant, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens Aggeritur tumulo tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrantes patrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit> (20): <cit><quote lang="la">aggesta fluminibus terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerebatur caespes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay to one's charge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n1546.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stick together soft masses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec genera (laterum ex terrā cretosā factorum) non sunt ponderosa et faciliter adgeruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aggestim: <entryFree id="n1547" type="hapax" key="aggestim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggestim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>aggero</etym>, <sense id="n1547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in heaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 13, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aggestio: <entryFree id="n1548" type="main" key="aggesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggestĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing to</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">a heaping up;</hi> in concr., <hi rend="ital">a mass of mud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heap of sand</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aggestus: <entryFree id="n1549" type="main" key="aggestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying to</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">a collecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an accumulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collection</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pabuli, materiae, lignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1</bibl></cit>. 35: <cit><quote lang="la">copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1550" type="main" key="aggestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">aggestum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevation formed like a dike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prunas unius aggesti inseruere juncturis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
agglomero: <entryFree id="n1551" type="main" key="agglo^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-glŏmĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n1551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wind on</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as on a ball</hi>); only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to annex;</hi> and se, <hi rend="ital">to join one's self to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et (se) lateri adglomerant nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 458</bibl></cit>: Sigeaque pestis adglomerare fretum, <hi rend="ital">raises it up</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as a ball</hi>), i. e. <hi rend="ital">heaps it up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:499" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 499</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
agglutino: <entryFree id="n1552" type="main" key="agglu_ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-glūtĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n1552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solder</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cement to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to fit closely to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1552.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tu illud (prooemium) desecabis, hoc adglutinabis, <hi rend="ital">you may remove that introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and add this instead of it</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid fronti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>, n. 1; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26</bibl>, n. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 245</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adglutinando auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 29, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fragmenta teporata adglutinantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adglutinabo pisces fiuminum tuorum squamis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1552.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi ad malum malae res plurimae se adglutinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adglutinavi mihi omnem domum Israël,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aggravesco: <entryFree id="n1553" type="main" key="aggra^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-grăvesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n1553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become heavy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1553.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: propinquitate parti, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 5</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 85 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n1553.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., of sickness, <hi rend="ital">to become violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Philumenae magis morbus adgravescat,</quote> <trans><tr>grow worse</tr>, <tr>be aggravated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aggravo: <entryFree id="n1554" type="main" key="aggra^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-grăvo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (first used in the Aug. per., and only in prose writers; perh. formed by Livy, who uses it very often), <sense id="n1554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to add to the weight of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make heavier.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1554.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgravatur pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgravavit jugum nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compedem meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Thren. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1554.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n1554.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make worse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">more dangerous</hi>, <pb n="71" /> <cb n="AGGR" /> <hi rend="ital">to aggravate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (bello) si adgravatae res essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor adgravans capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare aggravatis corda vestra?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>harden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1554.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incommode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ope hostis, quae adgravaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo adgravante (eum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia rationes nostras adgravatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta, quae per se nihil reum adgravare videantur,</quote> <trans><tr>appear to be without weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aggredio: <entryFree id="n1555" type="main" key="aggre^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-grĕdĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n1555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form of aggredior; cf. adorio), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to go to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si adgredias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: scrupea saxea Bacchi templa prope adgredite, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 97, Ribbeck has <hi rend="ital">adgreditur</hi>, but proposes <hi rend="ital">adgreditor</hi>).—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: ut adgrederer dolis, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792, 22</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">facillimis quibusque adgressis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aggredior: <entryFree id="n1556" type="main" key="aggre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-grĕdĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>gradior</etym> (<sense id="n1556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">second pers. pres.</hi> adgredire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 124</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> adgrediri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgredirier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> adgretus, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. p. Müll.), <hi rend="ital">to go to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> a person or thing (coinciding, both in signif. and constr., with adire; Horace never uses adgredi; Cic. and the histt. very freq.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <case>acc.</case> (cf. Zumpt, § 387). </sense><sense id="n1556.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc Philenium adgredimur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgredior hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">loc. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim repelletur inde, quo adgredi cupiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1556.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1556.3" n="A" level="2"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to go to or approach</hi>, for the purpose of conversing or advising with, asking counsel of, entreating or soliciting something of; <hi rend="ital">to apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">address</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin ego hunc adgredior de illā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Locustam ego Romae adgrediar atque, ut arbitror, commovebo,</quote> <trans><tr>apply to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Damasippum velim adgrediare,</quote> <trans><tr>to solicit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos adgreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgredi aliquem pecuniā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to attempt to bribe</tr>, <tr>to tamper with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos legatos eādem viā (i. e. pecuniā) adgressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dictis,</quote> <trans><tr>to accost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem precibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to pray one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos largitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius alicujus modestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatem Principis,</quote> <trans><tr>spur on</tr>, <tr>stir up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1556.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> one in a hostile manner, <hi rend="ital">to fall on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi> (prop. of an open, direct attack, while <hi rend="ital">adorior</hi> denotes a secret, unexpected approach): <cit><quote lang="la">quis audeat bene comitatum adgredi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites palantes inermes adgredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgressus eum interfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus adgressurus est Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno gravatum ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 659</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:482" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 482</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 333: senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopinantes adgressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1556.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set about</hi> an act or employment, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi> (so esp. often in Cic.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <case>acc.</case> —With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: adgretus fari, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 6</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de re disserere adgredior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 941</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:981" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 981</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā prius adgrediar quam de re fundere fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquam gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 168</bibl></cit>; once in Cic. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: de quibus dicere adgrediar, Off. 2, 1. —With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adgredior ad hanc disputationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad petitionem consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad faciendam injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adgredior ancipitem causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus negotiis priusquam adgrediare (sc. ea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgrediar igitur (sc. causam), si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam rem adgreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgrediturque inde ad pacis longe maximum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus adgredior opimum casibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa magnis ducibus non adgredienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos honores,</quote> <trans><tr>enter upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatale adgressi avellere Palladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtham beneficiis vincere adgressus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">75, 2: Caesarem pellere adgressi sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or 17</bibl></cit>: isthmum perfodere <cb n="AGIL" /> adgressus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aggrego: <entryFree id="n1557" type="main" key="aggre^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-grĕgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>grex, grego</etym>. * <sense id="n1557.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">add to a flock</hi>: ADGREGARE: ad gregem ducere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1557.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To add to</hi> something: se adgregare, <hi rend="ital">to attach one's self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi> (more rare than <hi rend="ital">adjungere</hi>, and only in prose, but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si secum suos eduxerit, et eodem ceteros naufragos adgregaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium eodem indicio ad patris interitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to implicate in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te semper in nostrum numerum adgregare soleo,</quote> <trans><tr>to add to</tr>, <tr>reckon among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meam voluntatem ad summi viri dignitatem adgregāssem,</quote> <trans><tr>had shown my zeal for the increase of his reputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: se ad eorum amicitiam, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ally themselves to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani adgregant se Amphotero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>; and instead of se adgregare, the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne desciscentibus adgregarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aggressio: <entryFree id="n1558" type="main" key="aggressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggressĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aggredior</etym>. <sense id="n1558.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi> a thing (very rare; in the class. per. only in rhet. lang. for a proëm, introduction to a speech, = prooemium): cumque animos primā adgressione occupaverit, infirmabit excludetque contraria, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 50</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a rhetorical syllogism</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pixei/rhma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:28:14:27" default="NO">28, 14, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1558.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi> (cf. aggredior, II. B.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 27</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
aggressor: <entryFree id="n1559" type="main" key="aggressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggressor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that attacks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assailant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aggressor</hi> (only in the Lat. of the Pandects), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; also for <hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:9:7 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 9, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aggressura: <entryFree id="n1560" type="main" key="aggressu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggressūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi> (only in App. and in the Pandects), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 5</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190, 41</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
aggressus: <entryFree id="n1561" type="main" key="aggressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of aggredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1562" type="main" key="aggressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aggressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aggredior</etym>. * <sense id="n1562.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi> (cf. aggredior, II. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1562.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An entering upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginning;</hi> opp. exitus (cf. aggredior, II. C.), Firm. Math. 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
agguberno: <entryFree id="n1563" type="main" key="aggu^berno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ag-gŭberno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adg-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ad, intensive</etym>, <sense id="n1563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1563.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adguberno iter pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1563.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgubernante fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
agilis: <entryFree id="n1564" type="main" key="agi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">agĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>. <sense id="n1564.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can be easily moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily movable</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): qui restitissent agili classi naves tormenta machinasque portantes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec querulas agili percurrit pollice chordas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factus inops agili peragit freta caerula remo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 65</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agilis rota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër agilior et tenuior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:10 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1564.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1564.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That moves easily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quickly; nimble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>: sic tibi secretis agilis dea saltibus adsit, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleet-footed Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic super agilis Cyllenius,</quote> <trans><tr>swift-flying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 720</bibl></cit>.—Also of things, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudden</hi>: agilem dari facilemque victoriam, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 58, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio agilior et acrior et instantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 164 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1564.3" n="B" level="2"> With the accessory idea of activity, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">precipitate in action; prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi> (with direct reference to the action, and hence used of inanimate things; while sedulus, <hi rend="ital">diligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduous</hi>, regards more the state of mind; both, however, refer to the simple idea of mobility, Doed. Syn. 1, 122; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Differ. 2203" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Differ. 2203</bibl> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nunc agilis fio et mersor civilibus undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit> (= negotiosus, <foreign lang="greek">praktiko/s</foreign>, Schol.): <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt Sedatum celeres, agilem gnavumque remissi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse quid audes? Quae circumvolitas agilis thyma,</quote> <trans><tr>busy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir navus, agilis, providus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:516" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 516</bibl> (opp. ignavus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 9, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus agilis et pronus ad motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, as given by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 606</bibl> P., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 89</bibl>, is agillĭmus; but <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 162</bibl>, agilissĭmus; both forms, however, are given without examples; cf. Rudd. I. p. 171, n. 12.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭlĭter</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
agilitas: <entryFree id="n1565" type="main" key="a^gi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>agilis</etym>, <sense id="n1565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of</hi> agilis, <hi rend="ital">mobility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nimbleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agility.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: navium, <cb n="AGIT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus et agilitas alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>mobility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:180" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 180</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1565.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: agilitas, ut ita dicam, mollitiaque naturae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
agiliter: <entryFree id="n1566" type="main" key="a^gi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. agilis.</entryFree>
agina: <entryFree id="n1567" type="main" key="a^gi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ago</etym>, <sense id="n1567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the opening in the upper part of a balance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which the tongue moves</hi> (agitur), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 10</bibl> Müll.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 41</bibl>; Pudic. 9.— Hence, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgīnātōres</orth> <itype>dicuntur, qui parvo lucro moventur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 10</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
agipes: <entryFree id="n1568" type="gloss" key="a^gi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ago-pes</etym>, in Lucilius = pedarius senator, <sense id="n1568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a senator who silently passes over to him for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with whom he intends to vote</hi>, Fest. s. v. pedarium, p. 210 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">agipes ut vocem mittere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:page=145" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> p. 145</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
agis: <entryFree id="n1569" type="main" key="A_gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āgis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Agin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)agis</foreign>. <sense id="n1569.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Sparta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murdered by his own subjects</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl>; cf. Plut. Agis.—</sense><sense id="n1569.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Brother of Agesilaus and son of Archidamus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1569.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Lycian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 751</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
agitabilis: <entryFree id="n1570" type="hapax" key="a^gi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>agito</etym>, <sense id="n1570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be easily moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily movable</hi> (as an epitheton ornans of the air), <hi rend="ital">light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
agitatio: <entryFree id="n1571" type="main" key="a^gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of being in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi> (in good class. prose). </sense><sense id="n1571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitationes fluctuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatio et motus linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatione agitabitur terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 24, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1571.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly in philos. lang.), <hi rend="ital">activity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam animus agitatione et motu esse vacuus potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 62, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibenda est actio quaedam, non solum mentis agitatio,</quote> <trans><tr>contemplation</tr>, <tr>thought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnarum rerum agitatio et administratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>prosecution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est sapienti agitatione virtutum,</quote> <trans><tr>the practice</tr>, <tr>exercise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 109" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatione rerum ad virtutem capessendam excitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
agitator: <entryFree id="n1572" type="main" key="a^gi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, pr. <sense id="n1572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that puts</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in motion;</hi> used exclusively of those who drive animals (asses, horses, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a driver</hi> (cf. agaso): agitator aselli, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a peasant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum Achillis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the charioteer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustineat currum ut bonu' saepe agitator equosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:page=154" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> p. 154</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1572.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a charioteer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a combatant in the games of the circus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ut agitator callidus, priusquam ad finem veniam, equos sustinebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2593 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatores consopiti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
agitatrix: <entryFree id="n1573" type="main" key="a^gi^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>agitator</etym>, <sense id="n1573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that puts</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in motion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum agitatrix Diana,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>huntress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 141</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 6, 15</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
agitatus: <entryFree id="n1574" type="main" key="a^gi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>agito</etym>, <sense id="n1574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a state of motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a being in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi> (only ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n1574.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 12</bibl> Müll. dub. (Müll. reads: ubi id agitatur); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">41 Müll.: anima corpori praestat agitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si agitatu suo aquam moverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sat. 7, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1574.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <trans><tr>activity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 42</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
agito: <entryFree id="n1575" type="main" key="a^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>, as if the supine were <sense id="n1575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agitu;</hi> cf.: quaero quaerito. </sense><sense id="n1575.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impel</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, or in more elevated prose; from poetry it passed, after the Aug. per., into common prose). </sense><sense id="n1575.2" n="A" level="2"> Of cattle, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> (cf. ago): <cit><quote lang="la">calcari quadrupedem agitabo advorsum clivom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulo boves agitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:38:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 38, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc in curru bijugos agitare leones,</quote> <trans><tr>drives her span of lions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitantur quadrigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 41</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad flumina currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit agitari currum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: lanigeros greges hirtasque capellas, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">to tend</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 287</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacros jugales (dracones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigas bigasque et equos desultorios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.3" n="B" level="2"> Of the motion of other things, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triremem in portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibusque leves agitavit habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:667" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 667</bibl></cit>: caput, <hi rend="ital">to move the head</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in token of assent</hi> = annuere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:567" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 567</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arundinem vento agitatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of animals, <hi rend="ital">to hunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>: etiamsi excitaturus <pb n="72" /> <cb n="AGIT" /> non sis nec agitaturus feras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila insectans alias aves atque agitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidas columbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 606</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 300</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:539" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu timidos onagros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:409 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 409 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1575.4" n="C" level="2"> Of the motion caused by the wind, <hi rend="ital">to drive to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toss about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus enim fit, ubi est agitando percitus aër,</quote> <trans><tr>when the air is violently agitated and driven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare ventorum vi agitari atque turbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta ponti Incipiunt agitata tumescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyris agitata Tempe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis agitatur pinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres agitantur orni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitaret aura capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.5" n="D" level="2"> Of the motion caused by the water: agitata numina Trojae, <hi rend="ital">tossed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">driven about upon the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.6" n="E" level="2"> In gen., of the motion caused by other things: <cit><quote lang="la">magnes (lapis) agitat (ferri ramenta) per aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1054" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1054</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitari inter se concursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: pulsu externo agitari, Macr Somn. Scip. 9.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of mist, <hi rend="ital">to produce it by motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>: dejectuque (Peneus) gravi tenues agitantia fumos Nubila conducit, <hi rend="ital">and by its impetuous descent</hi> (into the valley) <hi rend="ital">raises clouds producing mist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 571</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1575.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1575.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel one</hi> to something: <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, sometimes <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi> (so in Florus very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">in furias agitantur equae,</quote> <trans><tr>are excited to fury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare plebem,</quote> <trans><tr>to stir up</tr>, <tr>rouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:11:6:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 6, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatus cupiditate regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens sacratis legibus agitata in exitium urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive hither and thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi> (the fig. taken from the sea agitated by storm; cf. Gernh. and Beier upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">dii deaeque te agitant irati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra bilis agitat hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos agitent furiae, neque usquam consistere patiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum furiis agitatus Orestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 471</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">suum quemque scelus agitat amentiaque afficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare et insequi poëtas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl> and 41: <cit><quote lang="la">multis injuriis jactata atque agita ta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est magni viri, rebus agitatis (= perturbatis, Beier) punire sontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitabatur animus inopiā rei familiaris et conscientiā scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos conscientia defectionis agitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus metu atque libidine diversus agitabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>was drawn in different directions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 25, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12</bibl>. ne te semper inops agitet vexetque cupido, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos agitabat timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore et metu agitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriis agitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:8:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To assail with reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult; to reprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitat rem militarem, insectatur totam legationem,</quote> <trans><tr>attacks</tr>, <tr>ridicules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 28, 109</bibl>: mea saevis agitat fastidia verbis, Hor Epod. 12, 13; without <hi rend="ital">verbis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitant expertia frugis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. P. 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesanum poëtam agitant pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 456</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.11" n="D" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urge on</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to accomplish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be employed in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be engaged in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate;</hi> v. ago, II. D. (in the historians, esp. Sallust, very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Haec ego non agitem?</quote> <trans><tr>should I not drive at?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc agitemus convivium vino et sermone suavi,</quote> <trans><tr>let us celebrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 431</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl> festa gaudia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 423</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum natalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so festos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agraria lex a Flavio tribuno plebis vehementer agitabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>was powerfully urged</tr>, <tr>supportcd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum praecepta parentis mei agitarem,</quote> <trans><tr>was striving to comply with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 2</bibl></cit> (modestius dictum pro: <cit><quote lang="la">studere, ut agerem, Cort.): laeti pacem agitabamus,</quote> <trans><tr>were at peace</tr>, <tr>enjoyed the delights of peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit se missum a consule venisse quaesitum ab eo, pacem an bellum agitaturus foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 109:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 109, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam deditionis morā induciae agitabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>there was a truce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 24, 2</bibl>.— <cb n="AGME" /> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu primas agitant acies, certamina miscent,</quote> <trans><tr>as if they formed the front rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:330" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 330</bibl></cit>.—Hence of time, esp. life, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> (cf. ago, II. D 5.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita hominum sine cupiditate agitabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">festos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl></cit>.—In Sall., Tac., Flor., et al., agitare <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sojourn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi propius mare Africum agitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 18, 9</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. H. 3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fragm. H. 3, 11</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes">59, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:94:4" default="NO" valid="yes">94, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeti Germant agitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretus agitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium editis sine cultu atque eo ferocius agitabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:48" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.12" n="E" level="2"> Of the mind: agitare <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi> (in corde, in mente, animo, cum animo, secum, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to drive at a thing in the mind</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to turn over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate upon</hi>, and with the idea of action to be performed or a conclusion to be made, <hi rend="ital">to deliberate upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be occupied with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>, etc.: id ego semper mecum sic agito et comparo, Att ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 256, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom eam rem in corde agito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id agitans mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet nihil aliud quod agitet in mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est tuum sic agitare animo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnes animo agitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias secretis imaginationibus agitans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 36</bibl></cit> in animo bellum, Liv 21, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mente agitaret bellum renovare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid jamdudum invadere magnum Mens agitat mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A 9, 187</bibl></cit>. —Sometimes also without mente, animo, and the like, agitare <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, in the same signif: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi ille hoc unum agitare coeperit, esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem a me saepe deliberatam et multum agitatam requiris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: oratori omnia quaesita, disputata, tractata, agitata (<hi rend="ital">well considered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weighed</hi>) esse debent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 640</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq. in Tac.: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni agitare inter se mala servitutis, Agr 15: bellum adversus patrem agitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 86</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitanti de Claudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tempore ac loco caedis agitabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; 1, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">num</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitavere, num Messalinam depellerent amore Silli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl>.— With -<hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitavere placeretne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">an</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an Artaxata pergeret, agitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">quomodo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (of purpose): <cit><quote lang="la">ut Neronem pudor caperet, insita spe agitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1575.13" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To treat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">speak of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concerning a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confer about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate upon.</hi> Romae per omnīs locos et conventus de facto consulis agitart (<hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, for agitabatur), <hi rend="ital">discussions were had</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 30, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">cum de foedere victor agitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n1575.14" n="G" level="1"> Sat agitare, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, in Plaut., = sat agere, <hi rend="ital">to have enough to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have trouble with</hi>: nunc agitas sat tute tuarum rerum, Bacch. 4, 3, 23.</sense></entryFree>
aglaia: <entryFree id="n1576" type="main" key="A_gla_ia^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āglāiă</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āglăĭă</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āglăĭē</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aglai/a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*)aglai/h</foreign> (brightness, splendor), <sense id="n1576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the graces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 11, 60</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aglaophon: <entryFree id="n1577" type="main" key="Agla^o^pho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aglăŏphōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aglaofw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n1577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before Zeuxis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 3</bibl> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
aglaophotis: <entryFree id="n1578" type="greek" key="agla^o^pho_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aglăŏphōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)glaofwtis</foreign> (splendidly bright). <sense id="n1578.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A magic herb of a brilliant color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aglaophotim herbam, quae admiratione hominum propter eximium colorem acceperit nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1578.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The peony</hi> (Paeonia officinalis, Linn.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aglaspis: <entryFree id="n1579" type="greek" key="aglaspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aglaspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*a*g*l*a*s*p*i*s</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="greek">a)glao/s-a)spi/s</foreign> (with a glittering shield), <sense id="n1579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers with bright shields</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl> (others, as Weissenb. and Madv., perh. more correctly read <hi rend="ital">chalcaspides</hi>, with brazen shields).</sense></entryFree>
aglauros: <entryFree id="n1580" type="main" key="Aglauros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aglauros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n1580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Cecrops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sister of Herse and Pandrosos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed by Mercury into a stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 560</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">739, 819</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 166" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 166</bibl></sense></entryFree>
agmen: <entryFree id="n1581" type="main" key="agme^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">agmĕn</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>as if contr. from agimen, from ago; cf.: tegimen, tegmen, from tego</etym>. <sense id="n1581.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1581.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a train</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a collected multitude in motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moving forwards;</hi> of things of any kind, but esp. (so most freq. in prose) of men or animals. <cb n="AGME" /> —Of streams of water, <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">current</hi>: quod per amoenam urbem lent fluit agmine flumen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde super terras fluit agmine dulci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 272</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 638</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">in imitation of Enn., Virg. and Val. Fl.: leni fluit agmine Thybris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 782</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:721" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 721</bibl>.—Of a train or succession of clouds: <cit><quote lang="la">denso sunt agmine nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 100</bibl></cit>.—Of rain: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum caelo venit agmen aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>body</tr>, <tr>mass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 322</bibl></cit> —Of atoms: <cit><quote lang="la">agmine condenso naturam corporis explent,</quote> <trans><tr>crowded into a compact mass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 607</bibl></cit>.—Of oars: <cit><quote lang="la">agmine re morum ceieri,</quote> <trans><tr>with quick plashing of oars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 211</bibl></cit>.—Of a flock of birds: agmi ne magno. Corvorum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 381</bibl>.—Of a snake winding onwards: <cit><quote lang="la">cum medii nexus extremaeque agmina caudae Solvuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 424</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 212</bibl>.—Of clouds of dust following any thing in rapid motion, as men, animals, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina cervi Pulverulenta,</quote>
