Lup.</author> p. 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.25" n="e" level="4"> In certain circumstances, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi> (mostly belonging to familiar style): <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Quid nunc agimus? <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Quin redimus, <hi rend="ital">What shall we do now?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi! quid faciam? quid agam?</quote> <trans><tr>what shall I do? how shall I act?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agam, habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit> (= quid respondeam habeo, Don.) al.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ita quidam agebat,</quote> <trans><tr>was so acting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: a Burro minaciter actum, <hi rend="ital">Burrus<pb n="75" /> <cb n="AGO" />  proceeded to threats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n1605.26" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transact</hi> (the most usual signif. of this word; in all periods; syn.: facere, efficere, transigere, gerere, tractare, curare): cui quod agat institutumst nullo negotio id agit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 254 Vahl.): ut quae egi, ago, axim, verruncent bene, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 23</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 114 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">At nihil est, nisi, dum calet, hoc agitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut id agam, quod missus huc sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: homines quae agunt vigilantes, agitantque, ea si cui in somno accidunt, minus mirum est, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">observabo quam rem agat,</quote> <trans><tr>what he is going to do</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Id quidem ago,</quote> <trans><tr>That is what I am doing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res vera agitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jam tempus agires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilis rebus agendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grassator ferro agit rem,</quote> <trans><tr>does the business with a dagger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:659" default="NO">6, 659</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiis geritur res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ego nunc de istac re ago,</quote> <trans><tr>do nothing about that matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam id actumst,</quote> <trans><tr>after this is accomplished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid actumst?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aliud agebam nisi eum defenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid temere ac fortuitu, inconsiderate negligenterque agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agamus quod instat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiaverunt ei omnia, quae egerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 5, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum negotium agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to mind one's business</tr>, <tr>attend to one's own affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 211</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestrum negotium agatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Thess. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque satis Bruto constabat, quid agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam res in Africā gestas, quoque modo actae forent, fama divolgavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu delibera, utrum colloqui malis an per litteras agere quae cogitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—With the spec. idea of completing, finishing: jucundi acti labores, a proverb in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.27" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue</hi> in one's mind, <hi rend="ital">to drive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be occupied with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have in view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi> (cf. agito, II. E., volvo and voluto): <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid mens mea majus agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc variis mens ipsa modis agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:392" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere fratri proditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de intrandā Britanniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.28" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">a verbal subst.</hi>, as a favorite circumlocution for the action indicated by the <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/gw</foreign> with verbal subst.): <cit><quote lang="la">rimas agere (sometimes ducere),</quote> <trans><tr>to open in cracks</tr>, <tr>fissures</tr>, <tr>to crack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 728</bibl>: vos qui regalis corporis custodias agitis, <hi rend="ital">keep watch over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 323, 1</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 43, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excubias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:245" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excubias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationem agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to triumph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:132" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">experimenta agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to care for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 302</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. 18: <cit><quote lang="la">curam ejus egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblivia agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to forget</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to trifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 78</bibl>, and often: <cit><quote lang="la">officinas agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep shop</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4266</bibl></cit>.—So esp.: agere gratias (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> grates; never in <number>sing.</number> gratiam), <hi rend="ital">to give thanks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thank;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/rin e)/xein</foreign> (<hi rend="ital">habere gratiam</hi> is to be or feel grateful; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/rin ei)de/nai</foreign>; and <hi rend="ital">referre gratiam</hi>, to return a favor, requite; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/rin a)podido/nai</foreign>; cf. Bremi ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 7</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">diis gratias pro meritis agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haud male agit gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magnas vero agere gratias Thaïs mihi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dis magnas merito gratias habeo atque ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 80</bibl></cit>: Lentulo nostro egi per litteras tuo nomine <cb n="AGO" /> gratias diligenter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl>: immortales ago tibi gratias agamque dum vivam; <cit><quote lang="la">nam relaturum me adfirmare non possum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: maximas tibi omnes gratias agimus, C. Caesar; <cit><quote lang="la">majores etiam habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebatio magnas ago gratias, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: renuntiate gratias regi me agere; <cit><quote lang="la">referre gratiam aliam nunc non posse quam ut suadeam, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 37</bibl></cit>: grates tibi ago, summe Sol, vobisque, reliqui Caelites, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet et invito grates agit inde parenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 152</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:435" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 435</bibl>; 484; 10, 291; 681; 14, 596; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 15, 36 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in connection with this, laudes agere: Jovis fratri laudes ago et grates gratiasque habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae laudes gratesque agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diis immortalibus laudesque et grates egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agi sibi gratias passus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl>; but oftener <hi rend="ital">grates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gratis</hi> in Tac.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius egit gratīs benevolentiae patrum, A. 6, 2: agit grates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl and class.): Romulus in caelo cum dīs agit aevom, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; so Pac. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 49</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl>: domi aetatem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutem,</quote> <bibl <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia secura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 377</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 926</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruri agere vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam in terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillam vitam agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hunc (diem) agerem si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver magnus agebat Orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestiva agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass</tr>, <tr>be in</tr>, <tr>summer quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:21" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses jam tibi esse actos vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis agitur hic septimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 700</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior pars acta (est) diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta est per lacrimas nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 58</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc principium anni agebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actis quindecim annis in regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nona aetas agitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:28 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 28 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">annus</hi> and <hi rend="ital">an ordinal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be of a certain age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be so old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum annum ago et octogesimum,</quote> <trans><tr>am eighty-four years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Annum agens sextum decimum patrem amisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>.—Metaph.: sescentesimum et quadragesimum annum urbs nostra agebat, <hi rend="ital">was in its</hi> 640<hi rend="ital">th year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 37</bibl>.— Hence also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (rare), <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> time, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> somewhere: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas laeta agere,</quote> <trans><tr>was joyful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Marius apud primos agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 101:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 101, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Africa, quā procul a mari incultius agebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 89:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud illos homines, qui tum agebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracia discors agebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juxta Hermunduros Naristi agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra jugum plurimae gentes agunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallos trans Padum agentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (annis) exul Rhodi agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere inter homines desinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellius non in ore volgi agere,</quote> <trans><tr>was not in the sight of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aciem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 7</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 55</bibl></cit> = versari.—</sense><sense id="n1605.30" n="6" level="3"> In the lang. of offerings, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to despatch</hi> the victim, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay.</hi> In performing this rite, the sacrificer asked the priest, agone, <hi rend="ital">shall I do it?</hi> and the latter answered, age or hoc age, <hi rend="ital">do it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui calido strictos tincturus sanguine cultros semper, Agone? rogat, nec nisi jussus agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1</bibl></cit>. 321 (cf. agonia and agonalia): <cit><quote lang="la">a tergo Chaeream cervicem (Caligulae) gladio caesim graviter percussisse, praemissā voce,</quote> <trans><tr>hoc age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>. —This call of the priest in act of solemn sacrifice, Hoc age, warned the assembled multitude to be quiet and give attention; hence hoc or id and sometimes haec or istuc agere was used for, <hi rend="ital">to give attention to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heed;</hi> and followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have it in view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, etc.; cf. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 15</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>: hoc agite, Plaut. As. prol. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc agite, of poetry,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere hoc possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:969" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 969</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7</bibl>, <cb n="AGO" /> 48: <cit><quote lang="la">hoccine agis an non? hoc agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc istuc age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc egit civis Romanus ante te nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id et agunt et moliuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oculi, aures, etc.) quasi fenestrae sunt animi, quibus tamen sentire nihil queat mens, nisi id agat et adsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: qui id egerunt, ut gentem . . . collocarent, <hi rend="ital">aimed at this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum maxime fallunt, id agunt, ut viri boni esse videantur,</quote> <trans><tr>keep it in view</tr>, <tr>that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idne agebas, ut tibi cum sceleratis, an ut cum bonis civibus conveniret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc agit, ut doleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc age, ne mutata retrorsum te ferat aura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid tuus ille destrictus gladius agebat?</quote> <trans><tr>have in view</tr>, <tr>mean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid aliud egimus nisi ut, quod hic potest, nos possemus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sin autem id actum est, ut homines postremi pecuniis alienis locupletarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certiorem eum fecit, id agi, ut pons dissolveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego id semper egi, ne bellis interessem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Also, the opp.: alias res or aliud agere, <hi rend="ital">not to attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue secondary</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subordinate objects: Ch.</hi> Alias res agis. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Istuc ago equidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo animadverti eum jocari atque alias res agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui vides, quam alias res agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:233" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 66, 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud agens ac nihil ejusmodi cogitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.31" n="7" level="3"> In relation to public affairs, <hi rend="ital">to conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>: agere bellum, <hi rend="ital">to carry on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wage war</hi> (embracing the whole theory and practice of war, while <hi rend="ital">bellum gerere</hi> designates the bodily and mental effort, and the bearing of the necessary burdens; and <hi rend="ital">bellum facere</hi>, the actual outbreak of hostile feelings, v. Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 28</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui longe aliā ratione ac reliqui Galli bellum agere instituerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochus si tam in agendo bello parere voluisset consiliis ejus (Hannibalis) quam in suscipiendo instituerat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena bella mercedibus agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bellaque non puero tractat agenda puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 182</bibl></cit> (also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 230</bibl>, Gron. Observ. 2, 3, 227, for the usu. <hi rend="ital">obit</hi>, with one MS., reads <hi rend="ital">agit;</hi> so Merkel).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martem for bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: agere proelium, <hi rend="ital">to give battle</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">levibus proeliis cum Gallis actis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of offices, employments, etc., <hi rend="ital">to conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold the assizes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 44</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">used of the governors of provinces: judicium agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivorum coetus agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make assemblies of</tr>, <tr>to assemble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recensum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:35:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 35, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centurionatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscum agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to have charge of the treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to collect the taxes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquisitionem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam alicujus rei agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to have the management of</tr>, <tr>to manage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae curationem agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: dilectum agere, <hi rend="ital">to make a levy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to levy</hi> (postAug. for dilectum habere, Cic., Cæs., Sall.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 7</bibl> and 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n1605.32" n="8" level="3"> Of civil and political transactions in the senate, the forum, before tribunals of justice, etc., <hi rend="ital">to manage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim recordere, quae ego de te in senatu egerim, quae in contionibus dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de condicionibus pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summā re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de Catilinae conjuratione ageretur in curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de poenā alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de agro plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—Hence the phrase: agere cum populo, of magistrates, <hi rend="ital">to address the people in a public assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the purpose of obtaining their approval</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rejection of a thing</hi> (while <pb n="76" /> <cb n="AGO" /> agere <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> populum signifies <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring before the people</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum populo agere est rogare quid populum, quod suffragiis suis aut jubeat aut vetet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere cum populo de re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quis de his postea ad senatum referat neve cum populo agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 43</bibl></cit>.—So also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus (rostra) ad agendum amplissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus cum agere coepisset, tertio quoque verbo orationis suae me appellabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to common life. </sense><sense id="n1605.33" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Agere cum aliquo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">re</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negotiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk with one about a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing; to endeavor to persuade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">move one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc.: nihil age tecum (sc. cum odore vini); <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est ipsus (vini lepos)?</quote> <trans><tr>I have nothing to do with you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae (patria) tecum, Catilina, sic agit,</quote> <trans><tr>thus pleads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">algae Inquisitores agerent cum remige nudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inter se dubiis de rebus agebant,</quote> <trans><tr>thus treated together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo et praesens tecum egi diligenter, et scripsi ad te accurate antea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egi cum Claudiā et cum vestrā sorore Muciā, ut eum ab illā injuriā deterrerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misi ad Metellum communes amicos, qui agerent cum eo, ut de illā mente desisteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callias quidam egit cum Cimone, ut eam (Elpinicen) sibi uxorem daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcibiades praesente vulgo agere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua Caesares obtinendae Armeniae egerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Lucretius agere varie, rogando alternis suadendoque coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—In Suet. once agere cum senatu, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state to the Senate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius egit cum senatu non debere talia praemia tribui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.34" n="b" level="4"> With the <hi rend="ital">advv. bene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praeclare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">male</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to deal well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ill with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to treat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">use well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile est bene agere cum eis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene egissent Athenienses cum Miltiade, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare cum aliquo agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Male agis mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum creditoribus suis male agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 84</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tu contra me male agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ill with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badly off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelleget secum actum esse pessime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare mecum actum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl>: exstat cujusdam non inscitus jocus bene agi potuisse cum rebus humanis, si Domitius pater talem habuisset uxorem, <hi rend="ital">it would have gone well with human affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">been well for mankind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> without <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: agitur praeclare, si nosmet ipsos regere possumus, <hi rend="ital">it is well done if</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is a splendid thing if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivitur cum eis, in quibus praeclare agitur si sunt simulacra virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene agitur pro noxiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.35" n="9" level="3"> Of transactions before a court or tribunal. </sense><sense id="n1605.36" n="a" level="4"> Aliquid agere ex jure, ex syngraphā, ex sponso, or simply the <case>abl.</case> jure, lege, litibus, obsignatis tabellis, causā, <hi rend="ital">to bring an action</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to manage a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plead a case</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex jure civili et praetorio agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam ex syngraphā agere cum populo,</quote> <trans><tr>to litigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sponso egit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Una injuriast Tecum. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Lege agito ergo, <hi rend="ital">Go to law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere lege in hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo se lege agere dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 5</bibl></cit>: summo jure agere, <hi rend="ital">to assert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim one's right to the full extent of the law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim gladiis mecum, sed litibus agetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causā quam vi agere malle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellis obsignatis agis mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jure, ut opinor, agat, jure increpet inciletque,</quote> <trans><tr>with right would bring her charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:963" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 963</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Castrensis jurisdictio plura manu agens,</quote> <trans><tr>settles more cases by force</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi manu agitur,</quote> <trans><tr>when the case is settled by violent hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.37" n="b" level="4"> Causam or rem agere, <hi rend="ital">to try</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plead a case;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam apud centumviros egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar cum ageret apud censores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egi causam adversus magistratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 13, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">orator agere dicitur causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: causam isto modo agere, <cb n="AGO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:132" default="NO">14, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agit causas liberales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: qui ad rem agendam adsunt, M. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (M. Tullius) et ipsam se rem agere diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 45</bibl></cit>: Gripe, accede huc; <cit><quote lang="la">tua res agitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is being tried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and extra-judicially: rogo ad Caesarem meam causam agas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Una (factio) populi causam agebat, altera optimatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3</bibl></cit>; so, agere, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plead'</hi> ad judicem sic agi solet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam solute agere, tam leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu istuc nisi fingeres, sic ageres?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 143</bibl> and 144; 14, 32.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to common life; with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sed estne hic ipsus, de quo agebam?</quote> <trans><tr>of whom I was speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa non solum exponenda, sed etiam graviter copioseque agenda est,</quote> <trans><tr>to be discussed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium bella, quae agimus,</quote> <trans><tr>are treating of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1605.38" n="c" level="4"> Agere aliquem reum, <hi rend="ital">to proceed against one as accused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus agitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 20</bibl></cit>; 3, 13; and with the <hi rend="ital">gen. of the crime</hi>, with which one is charged: <cit><quote lang="la">agere furti,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse of theft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterii cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; and often in the Pandects.—</sense><sense id="n1605.39" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> of the thing which is the subject of accusation, <hi rend="ital">to be in suit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in question; it concerns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is about</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non nunc pecunia, sed illud agitur, quomodo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non capitis ei res agitur, sed pecuniae,</quote> <trans><tr>the point in dispute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aguntur injuriae sociorum, agitur vis legum, agitur existimatio, veritasque judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si magna res, magna hereditas agetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: quā de re agitur, <hi rend="ital">what the point of dispute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">litigation is</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79</bibl>.—Hence, trop., </sense><sense id="n1605.40" n="(a)" level="5"> Res agitur, <hi rend="ital">the case is on trial</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">something is at stake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at hazard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in peril</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nos, quarum res agitur, aliter auctores sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi istic mea res minor agatur quam tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitur populi Romani gloria, agitur salus sociorum atque amicorum, aguntur certissima populi Romani vectigalia et maxima, aguntur bona multorum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus eorum aut caput agatur aut fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non libertas solum agebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:20 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 20 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tua res agitur, paries cum proximus ardet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 84</bibl></cit> (= in periculo versatur, Lambin.): <cit><quote lang="la">agitur pars tertia mundi,</quote> <trans><tr>is at stake</tr>, <tr>I am in danger of losing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 372</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.41" n="(b)" level="5"> Res acta est, <hi rend="ital">the case is over</hi> (and done for): acta haec res est; <cit><quote lang="la">perii,</quote> <trans><tr>this matter is ended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: hence, actum est de aliquo or aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">it is all over with a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actum hodie est de me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam de Servio actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actum est de collo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:4:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 4, 194</bibl></cit>.—So also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: actumst; <cit><quote lang="la">ilicet me infelicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si animus hominem pepulit, actumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actumst, ilicet, peristi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: periimus; <cit><quote lang="la">actumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.42" n="(g)" level="5"> Rem actam agere, <hi rend="ital">to plead a case already finished</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to act to no purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem actam agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 40</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">actum or acta agere: actum, aiunt, ne agas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta agimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.43" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To represent by external action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n1605.44" n="a" level="4"> Of an orator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sic ab illo acta esse constabat oculis, voce, gestu, inimici ut lacrimas tenere non possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 56, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere fortius et audentius volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n1605.45" n="b" level="4"> Of an actor, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ipse hanc acturust Juppiter comoediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 88</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. prol. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec agitur fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 72 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 72 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partīs,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a part in a play</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ballionem illum cum agit, agit Chaeream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestum agere in scaenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur canticum egisse aliquanto magis vigente motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to other relations, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">personate one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act the part of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behave like</hi>: has <cb n="AGO" /> partes lenitatis semper egi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egi illos omnes adulescentes, quos ille actitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socium magis imperii quam ministrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 28</bibl></cit>.—So of things poetically: <cit><quote lang="la">utrinque prora frontem agit,</quote> <trans><tr>serves as a bow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.46" n="11" level="3"> Se agere = se gerere, <hi rend="ital">to carry one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to behave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deport one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā mobilitate sese Numidae agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto ferocius ante se egerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se pro equitibus Romanis agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non principem se, sed ministrum egit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegenter se et avare agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudenter se agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienter se agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 18, 7</bibl></cit>. —Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile justeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aequo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxius et intentus agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.47" n="12" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imper.</hi>: age, agite, Ter., Tib., Lucr., Hor., Ov., never using <hi rend="ital">agite</hi>, and Catull. never <hi rend="ital">age</hi>, with which compare the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/ge, a)/gete</foreign> (also accompanied by the particles <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">en</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">igitur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nuncjam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verum</hi>, and by <hi rend="ital">sis</hi>); as an exclamation. </sense><sense id="n1605.48" n="a" level="4"> In encouragement, exhortation, <hi rend="ital">come! come on!</hi> (old Engl. <hi rend="ital">go to!</hi>) <hi rend="ital">up! on! quick!</hi> (cf. I. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>). (<foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> In the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, adsta, mane, audi, Enn. ap. Delr. Synt. 1, 99: age i tu secundum,</quote> <trans><tr>come</tr>, <tr>follow me!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, perge, quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, da veniam filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age, nunc experiamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age sis tu ... delude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto ferocius ante se egerint, agedum eam solve cistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agedum vicissim dic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum humanis concede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:962" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 962</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age modo hodie sero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age nuncjam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">En age, quid cessas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quare age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verum age,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quin age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en, age, Rumpe moras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eia age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 569</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.49" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">agite, pugni,</quote> <trans><tr>up</tr>, <tr>fists</tr>, <tr>and at 'em!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agite bibite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agite in modum dicite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quare agite ... conjungite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 372</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 627</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos agite ... volvite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:311" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agite nunc, divites, plorate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62</bibl></cit>.—Also age in the <number>sing.</number>, with a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi> in the <number>plur.</number> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)/ge ta/mnete</foreign>, Hom. Od. 3, 332; <foreign lang="greek">a)/ge dh\ trapei/omen</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Il. 3:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Il. 3, 441</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">age igitur, intro abite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">En agedum convertite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittite, agedum, legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ite age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Huc age adeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:169" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.50" n="b" level="4"> In transitions in discourse, <hi rend="ital">well then! well now! well!</hi> (esp. in Cic. Or. very freq.). So in Plaut. for resuming discourse that has been interrupted: age, tu interea huic somnium narra, Curc. 2, 2, 5: nunc age, res quoniam docui non posse creari, etc., <hi rend="ital">well now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since I have taught</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 266</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc age, quod superest, cognosce et clarius audi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 920</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 952</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:333" default="NO" valid="yes">333</bibl>; 730; 3, 418; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 109 al.: age porro, tu, qui existimari te voluisti interpretem foederum, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3</bibl>.—And age (as in a.) with a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">age vero, ceteris in rebus qualis sit temperantia considerate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.51" n="c" level="4"> As a sign of assent, <hi rend="ital">well! very well! good! right!</hi> Age, age, mansero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 61</bibl>: age, age, jam ducat; <cit><quote lang="la">dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Age, veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, sit ita factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age sane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 119</bibl>.!*? Position.—Age, used with another verb in the imperative, regularly stands before it, but in poetry, for the sake of the metre, it, </sense><sense id="n1605.52" n="I" level="1"> Sometimes follows such verb; as, </sense><sense id="n1605.53" n="a" level="4"> In dactylic metre: <cit><quote lang="la">Cede agedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:9:54" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 9, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dic age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 343</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:149" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Esto age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:42" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fare age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Finge age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Redde age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Surge age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vade age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 462</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 422</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agite: Ite agite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1605.54" n="b" level="4"> In other metres (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">appropera age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic age,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="77" /> <cb n="AGON" /> 32, 3;
